content:
Re: Versions and configurations

Daniel W. Connolly (connolly@w3.org)
Thu, 30 May 1996 08:38:54 -0400

  • Messages sorted by: [ date ][ thread ][ subject ][ author ]
  • Next message: Daniel W. Connolly: "Re: Version identifier in URL"
  • Previous message: David J. Fiander: "Re: Version identifier in URL"
  • Maybe in reply to: Keith Dawson: "Versions and configurations"
  • Next in thread: Kenji Takahashi: "Re: Versions and configurations" 
In message <v02120d13add26558e1a5@[204.167.8.225]>, Keith Dawson writes:
>
>Let's distinguish between the needs of the website developer/maintainer
>and those of the website visitor.

Good point. If what we're after here is not part of the interface
between web clients and servers, but rather a new interface
between web servers and CM systems, then URL syntax conventions
are fine: just like ?abc-1&def-2 in CGI.

Dan
